alert.note: Alert for Eastern Hampden; Eastern Hampshire; Northern Worcester; Southern Worcester (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 08 at 9:54PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Windham, Tolland, eastern Hartford, southwestern Worcester, southeastern Hampshire and southeastern Hampden Counties through 1100 PM EDT... At 953 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Somers, or 8 miles east of Enfield, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, penny size hail and heavy rain in excess of 1 inch. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Strong winds could cause minor damage such as downed branches. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Worcester, Hartford, New Britain, West Hartford, Manchester, East Hartford, Enfield, Glastonbury, Newington, Vernon, Windsor, Wethersfield, Mansfield, South Windsor, Farmington, Bloomfield, Rocky Hill, Holden, Southbridge, and Auburn. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. Do not drive through flooded roads or underpasses. Avoid low lying areas near small streams. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. For your safety, go indoors or to your vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for northern Connecticut...and western Massachusetts.
